events.comment:
A encore faire

Le jeu se passe ainsi
- Chaque fois qu'une ville est conquise par un des camps, elle génère des troupes sauf les verts qui apparaissent régulièrement dans une région sauf si il y a des soldats en onmbre dans cette région
- Le but prendre toute les villes
- Il y a les allemands avec qui on combat
- Il y a les polonais
- Il y a blancs


A faire dans un premier temps
- Mettre nom des villes
Probleme voir point 7 : quand on capture une ville et qu'on quitte la ville, si une unité arrive avant 10 secondes, elle reprend la ville directement et pas après un délais de 10 secondes. La raison étant que la valeur "entrain d'etre capturé" reste valable 10 secondes après le départ des troupes

Problème numéro 2 quand deux troupes sont au meme endroit, la ville ne devrait pas changer de sens

- si ville conquise, alors on recoit des soldats
- Blancs ont plusieurs stratégie différentes pour conquerir des villes on a les blanc tcheque qui détruise les armées sur le transibérien, les armées du sud qui tente de prendre moscou, les armées de l'est qui tente de prendre saint petersboug et les armée de kolchack qui attaque vers l'ouest
- Mettre les combats
- faire une intro et des pointz


et puis c'est tout


stavaza 28 1 2025 le syswteme de selection de bolchevik est moins bien qu'avant, a réparer
0 cheatcode
1_manipulation du menu
1_manipulation de la carte
2_presentationdelacarte
2 compter soldat sur le terrain au debut
3_deplacement_soldat
3.1 va plus vite pour les trains
3.2 la fleche
la fleche se dessine sur l'axe z zero
blocage mer

4.MINI MAP

Voici les calculs

Quand la camera est sur 0,0
La minimap est sur909,70

pour X
Quand la camera est sur 4720,0
La minimap doit etre sur 1320

donc pour X Xminimap = (909)+Xcamera*(251/4720)
251 = 1320-909


Pour Y
Quand la camera est sur 1720,0780
La minimap doit etre sur1164,161
donc pour Y Yminimap = 73+Ycamera*(88/780)
88= 161-73
5 les combats
6 Le NOM des villes
7 La prise d'une ville
7A prise par les rouges
7B  prise par les blancs
8 decoration_dynamique_unix
8.1 on donne un id a chaque pixel et on enregistre la position
8.2 le pixel ville change de couleurs en fonction de sa possession

D'abord il ya plusieurs camps blanc (allemand, kotchak, pays etrangers), on identifie ville qui sont en leur possession et troupes qui sot en leur possession

ON a les blancs du nord
Les blancs de l'extreme orient
Les blancs du caucase
Les blancs du sud
Les nationalistes d ukraine (ne veulent que certaines villes)
les nationalistes du belarus(ne veulent que certaines villes)
les nationalistes de pologne(ne veulent que certaines villes)
les nationalistes de finlande(ne veulent que certaines villes)
les anarchistes d ukraine (ne veulent pas de villes)
les verts (ne veulent pas de villes)
les allemands (ne veulent pas de villes)
les americains (ne veulent pas de villes)
les anglais (ne veulent pas de villes)
les francais (ne veulent pas de villes)
les japonais (ne veulent pas de villes)
IA blancs du nord
Etape 0 on remet toute les valeurs à zero et on créé des cercles de detections au dessus des troupes et des villes pour identifier le niveua de proximité 1 (le plus bas)
Etape 1 on idenitifie les villes et troupes qu'on controle, ennemi et neutre
Etape 2 on attaque les troupes ennemis qui sont dans notre zone de proximité 1
Etape 3 une fois que les ennemis sont exclus, on va attaquer la ville ennemi a proximite, on attaque avec la moitié de nos troupes mais si présence allié, on va à 75%

Commentaire, le code fonctionne, quand je relache la pression tactile cela devient rouge
QUand je commence la presion tactile cela devient vert et fonctionne sur mobile ou sur pc

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @e1e5en
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SwipeGesture
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Detect swipe gestures based on their distance and duration.
description: Use the "Enable swipe detection" action at the beginning of your scene.
Note: This extension does NOT support multitouch.
Expressions:
- `StartX`, `StartY`: Position where the swipe started
- `EndX`, `EndY`: Position where the swipe ended
- `Distance`: Length of the swipe, in pixels
- `DistanceX`, `DistanceY`: Distance the swipe moved in each axis
- `Angle`: Direction the swipe moved towards. Range (-180, 180)
- `Layer`: Layer used to detect swipe gestures
Conditions:
- `Is swipe detection enabled`
- `Is swipe in progress?` - A swipe starts when the mouse click or touch begins
- `Has swipe just ended?` - When the mouse or touch is released, this condition is true for one frame
- `Swipe moved in a direction (4-way movement)` - the direction value for 4 sides (UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT). In this case, the “circle” is divided into 4 segments of 90 degrees

- `Swipe moved in a direction (8-way movement)` - the direction value for 8 sides (UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, UP-LEFT, UP-RIGHT, DOWN-LEFT, DOWN-RIGHT). In this case, the “circle” is divided into 8 segments of 45 degrees.

events.comment: Reset "swipe just ended" detection

events.name: Detect if a swipe has ended
Detect if a new swipe started

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @ddabrahim
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Drag camera with the mouse (or touchscreen)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DragCameraWithPointer
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move a camera by dragging the mouse (or touchscreen).
description: Move a camera by dragging the mouse (or touchscreen).
How to use:
- Run this action on every frame that you want the camera to be movable by the mouse (or touchscreen)
- Select the mouse button to use (choose "left" for touchscreen)
- Select which directions the camera will move (vertical, horizontal, or both)
- Select the layer that will be moved
Tips:
- If no parameters are selected, the camera will move in both directions when the left mouse button (or touchscreen) are dragged.

eventsFunctions.description: Move a camera by dragging the mouse (or touchscreen).

eventsFunctions.sentence: Drag camera on layer _PARAM2_ in _PARAM3_ directions using _PARAM4_ mouse button

parameters.description: Directions that the camera can move (horizontal, vertical, both)
parameters.name: Direction

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ButtonStates
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use any object as a button and change appearance according to user interactions.
description: Use the "Button states" behavior to track user interactions with an object, including:
- Hovered
- Pressed
- Clicked
- Idle
Add additional behaviors to make juicy buttons with animated responses to user input:
- Size
- Color
- Animation
- Object effects

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Slash, Tristan Rhodes, @VictrisGames
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RTSUnitSelection
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow player to select units by clicking on them or dragging a selection box.
description: How To Use:
- The "Allow player to select units" action must run every frame to work properly
- When a drag is in progress, all units inside the selection box will be "PreSelected"
- When the drag is released, all "PreSelected" units will be changed to "Selected"
- Hold the additive select key to add units to selection
- Hold the subtractive select key to remove units from selection
Control Group controls:
- Ctrl + (1,2,3,4,5,6,7,9,0) assigns that Control Group to Selected units
- (1,2,3,4,5,6,7,9,0) selects all units that are assigned to that Control Group
Selection box:
- When dragging, the selection area will be drawn by a Shape Painter object.
- If a Shape Painter instance has not been added in the scene, it will be created automatically.
- To change the appearance of the selection area, change the Shape Painter properties.
- Reduce the fill opacity of the SelectionBox (shape painter object) so that units and terrain can be seen behind it.
Tips:
- Use the "Preselected" and "Selected" conditions to highlight units that are being interacted with
- Create an object group (i.e. "SelectableUnits") to control which types of objects can be selected
- Use conditions to restrict which object instances can be selected.
- Use the "SelectedUnitID" to design formations of units.
- Shape painter object should be on the same layer as the units being selected
- Always use ForEach() events when using the conditions in this extension because extension conditions do not currently perform object picking.

eventsFunctions.description: Allow player to select units by clicking on them or dragging a selection box.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Turret

It may be used with the **Bullet** extension to fire objects.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PointAndOrbit
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Point and orbit an object toward a position or angle.
description: Move an object in a circle around a specific point while pointing the moving object away from the center of the circle.
This feature is useful in games for weapons or targeting indicators that move around a player character.
Orbit distance and rotation speed can be changed easily.
The target position action can be used to follow the direction of the cursor.
The target angle action can be used to follow hte direction of a gamepad stick
# Example
![](https://i.imgur.com/N2KtaMT.png)

eventsFunctions.fullName: Point and Orbit toward a position
eventsFunctions.name: PointAndOrbit

Example: 50 .

description: ### How to use:
- Activate SelectionTools using the `De/Activate selection tools` action.
- Create a shape painter object and add the `Selection painter` behavior. Create a single instance of this object.
- Use `Activate rectangular selection`, `Activate polygonal selection`, or `Activate lasso selection` action to activate the type of selection you need.
- Use the `Select` condition to check which object instances are inside the selection.
### Tips:
- None of the actions require you to call them each frame. Use them with the `At the beginning of the scene` condition or `Triggred Once`.
- If you set `Pre-select?` to `Yes` in the `Select` condition, do not add a `Triggred Once` to that event.
#### Actions:
- `De/Activate selection tools`
- `Activate rectangular selection`
- `Activate polygonal selection`
- `Activate lasso selection`
- `Clear selection`
#### Condition:
- `Select`
- `Selection activated`
- `Current selection type`
#### Behavior:
- `Selection painter`

const vertexMinY = vertex[1].getAsNumber() < vertex[3].getAsNumber() ? vertex[1].getAsNumber() : vertex[3].getAsNumber();
const vertexMaxY = vertex[1].getAsNumber() > vertex[3].getAsNumber() ? vertex[1].getAsNumber() : vertex[3].getAsNumber();
//filter the targets whose center lie inside the rectangle
const result = objectX > vertexMinX && objectX < vertexMaxX && objectY > vertexMinY && objectY < vertexMaxY;

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ToggleSwitch
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Toggle switch that users can click or touch.
description: Add this behavior to a shape painter object.
When the toggle switch is in the *left* position, the condition `Checked` is "false". If it is in the *right* position, the condition `Checked` is true.
A halo appears when the mouse hovers near the toggle switch.
Toggle switch cannot be toggled by users if any of these are true:
- Toggle switch is hidden
- Toggle switch's layer is hidden
- Toggle switch is disabled
Toggle switch can always be changed by an action.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Use a shape-painter object to draw a toggle switch that users can click or touch.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ToggleSwitch

Use darker halo while being pressed
Drop Shadow

Draw Circle thumb
Make sure object doesn't get re-drawn every frame
